H0.text: Who was US Defence Secretary during the 'war' against Afghanistan. Colin Powell

H1.text: Who was US Defence Secretary during the 'war' against Afghanistan. Dick Cheney

H2.text: Who was US Defence Secretary during the 'war' against Afghanistan. George Tenet

H3.text: Who was US Defence Secretary during the 'war' against Afghanistan. Ramsfeld

A4.text: He was the 65th United States secretary of state from 2001 to 2005.

A5.text: Donald Rumsfeld served as secretary of defense for ten days fewer than McNamara.

A6.text: Following the resignation of CIA director George Tenet in 2004, Bush nominated Porter Goss to head the agency.

A7.text: Secretary of State Colin Powell had served as chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first president Bush.

A8.text: George Tenet was CIA director from 2001 to 2004.
